file_content.text: You are a phenomenon! No one will ever forget the name <FirstName>, Commander!
We will take it to these Exarchs!
Ready when you are to invade a Star Fortress, Commander.
You don't look too happy, Theron. What is it?
They were mounting a resistance. Locals, Imperials--they had resources, a plan, a base of operations.... Miot was arranging to smuggle weapons.
Gone, they're all gone. The Star Fortress over Bothawui vaporized every last trace, every last rebel, and then just... moved on, like it didn't matter anymore.
There must have been collateral damage in that strike. They'll need our help.
That's terrible. Send aid.
I don't know what a Star Fortress is, but I assume it belongs to Arcann. Let's obliterate it.
Retaliate.
Star Fortress? Is this what your specialists were arguing about?
The what over Bothawui?
Bey'wan Aygo is reaching out through back channels, trying to assess the situation. We've barely got enough supplies for our own people.
The Star Fortresses are battle stations--deadly and pervasive. Arcann's way of keeping the galaxy pliant. So many worlds we can't even contact because of these things.
There are dozens, maybe hundreds. We've tried everything to learn about their inner workings, weaknesses--nothing. And now this....
You do a good thing here.
Commander.
I'll destroy it.
If the Gravestone's weapons are so effective on the Eternal Fleet, it should be useful against these battle stations.
Let's use the Gravestone.
Point me to a Star Fortress. I'll go.
I'll take care of it.
Love nothing more, but it's not that simple. Frankly, I've only just gotten up to speed.
Couldn't figure out what to do about them. Still can't.
Show her the holo.
Show him the holo.
You'll go. And do what? Die?
We could try what we talked about. Stealth our way in.
Without the faintest clue of what we're up against, it's a massive risk....
All right. We have to do something. I'll go too--try to make heads or tails so we know how to deal with them.
It's going to work. We'll figure this out.
It'll be okay.
Anything else you can tell me about the Star Fortresses?
Wish we knew more.
Let's not waste any time.
Time is short. Let's go.
Sure hope so, Commander. Sure hope so.
Right now they're suppressing, but that's just to bide their time. I feel it, Commander--Arcann's got a plan for those things. The kind of plan you don't recover from.
The Gravestone's powerful, but these things have taken out destroyers without getting even a scratch.
No Gravestone, then, but there has to be a way.
Who's up for a little sabotage?
Find a way to access one and I'll tear it apart from the inside.
If it was that easy, I'd be all about it.
I'd love to see that.
Be right there with you, Commander.
Afraid not. Maybe after this trip, if we survive it....
Been sifting through everything you pulled from the Star Fortress. Starting to get a better picture of what we're facing here.
What are we looking at?
Like I thought, the scope of all this is--Actually, forget what I thought. It's beyond anything I imagined.
This friendly guy is part of a special order of Knights called Exarchs. You kind of met one. Best I can tell, one of them commands each Star Fortress.
That program seemed to be running things. What do they need a human component for?
What about the A.I.?
Some were with Valkorion and Arcann when I first arrived on Zakuul.
I've seen them before.
What do we know about them?
Exarchs?
They have their own ways and agenda. Secretive. All Senya said is they're devoted to the Eternal Throne and she'd never, ever want to cross one.
Yeah, they've been around a long while. Outside of that, there's not much to say.
Maybe Arcann doesn't trust artificial intelligence.
No way to slice covert plans from living brain tissue that I'm aware of. Makes sense.
That's not very comforting.
Other big piece I was able to work out--the Fortress is powered by a massive sun generator, like on Zakuul. We could use it to destroy the station...
...but, according to energy readings, the reactor's protected by a remote bunker on the planet's surface.
So we take out the bunker, then the reactor.
Tall order. I mean, not impossible, but we'd need ground forces and we don't have the personnel. Unless....
Miot's been pulling together reports of distress calls, skirmishes--the idea being we'd eventually follow up on them.
Not all of it is related to the Eternal Empire. It takes a lot of time and effort to sort out.
Here. These are a start. A handful of worlds under the threat of a Star Fortress, each with potential allies.
Just a handful. You said there are hundreds of these things.
Why stop there?
I can talk to these people, convince them our fight is worth the effort.
I'll go to them.
I'll make it very clear to them--they can work for us, or they can die.
They will serve us.
It'll take some doing. These people have problems of their own, they're not even thinking about Arcann or Zakuul.
This handful alone will be more than a handful--trust me. I say we focus on what we can for now.
I wish I could ask if you were joking and then you could say, "Of course I'm joking."
These people are already under threat of death, they can't be under threat of more death.
You've got to prove that helping us is their best possible option--which it is, they just don't know it yet.
If I help them out, I'm sure they'll help us back.
I'll lead by example.
In time, they will do as I say.
They will come to see things my way.
I will make them mine.
I got this Alliance together, didn't I? People love me.
No worries--it's me.
If you say so.
I hope you're right.
May you triumph at lightspeed, Commander.
Commander! It's a complete disaster. Come see my colleague Miot straight away. We have to do something!
I am in Aygo's headquarters. Please hurry.
Bey'wan Aygo was looking into it. Now he's busy trying to reach out to his fellow Bothans, so this falls on me.
Commander, we've intercepted transmissions from the Fortress's targeting system. Orbital strike imminent.
Detecting a lot of movement in that section of the Fortress. A contingent of Skytroopers are about to be deployed planetside.
Commander, bad news. Intercepted communication shows local officials are preparing to sell out to the Eternal Empire.
Commander, the Star Fortress is about to deploy some heavy hardware to the planet's surface.
Biological readings in the Research Wing are off the charts.
Prison records indicate a local Resistance leader is being transferred right now!
They're going to fire on Resistance camps below. Stop the strike or our allies will be obliterated.
If you can detain them, it would buy the Resistance some valuable time....
A deal like that is a blow we can't afford to take. Do what you can to stop it.
Can you intercept?
Commander, if you can reach them, we can extract!
Take a look. I've got a bad feeling about this....
Valiant effort, Commander. Can't win them all.
If only we'd had more time.
You did everything you could, Commander. We'll get them next time.
Blast it. We're too late.
